Finish the following sentence with the best choice: How to remove stain from wood counter-tops?

Choices:
- To remove stains, cut a lemon in half and sprinkle salt directly onto the stain. Use a lemon half to rub in the salt. Empty your iron of any water that might be left inside and turn it on to the highest possible setting. Apply the iron to the area of the the stain and leave it there for a very brief moment. Use a piece of 120-grit sandpaper to gently sand your wooden counter-tops. Remember to sand with the grain, not against it. After giving it a good once over with the 120-grit paper, switch to a piece of 180-grit sandpaper and sand the counter-tops, again keeping with the natural grain of the wood. Once you finish sanding, you’ll need to apply food-safe mineral oil and rub it into the wood grain with a clean rag. Let it soak into the wood for about 30 minutes, and then wipe away any excess mineral oil residue with a paper towel.
- To remove stains, cut a lemon in half and sprinkle salt directly onto the stain. Use a lemon half to rub in the salt. Empty your iron of any water that might be left inside and turn it on to the lowest possible setting. Place a clean cloth over the stain. Apply the iron to the area of the cloth covering the stain for a very brief moment. Use a piece of 120-grit sandpaper to gently sand your wooden counter-tops. Remember to sand with the grain. After giving it a good once over with the 120-grit paper, switch to a piece of 180-grit sandpaper and sand the counter-tops, again keeping with the natural grain of the wood. Once you finish sanding,  apply food-safe mineral oil and rub it into the wood grain with a clean rag. Let it soak into the wood for about 30 minutes, and then wipe away any excess mineral oil residue with a paper towel.

Answer:

To remove stains, cut a lemon in half and sprinkle salt directly onto the stain. Use a lemon half to rub in the salt. Empty your iron of any water that might be left inside and turn it on to the lowest possible setting. Place a clean cloth over the stain. Apply the iron to the area of the cloth covering the stain for a very brief moment. Use a piece of 120-grit sandpaper to gently sand your wooden counter-tops. Remember to sand with the grain. After giving it a good once over with the 120-grit paper, switch to a piece of 180-grit sandpaper and sand the counter-tops, again keeping with the natural grain of the wood. Once you finish sanding,  apply food-safe mineral oil and rub it into the wood grain with a clean rag. Let it soak into the wood for about 30 minutes, and then wipe away any excess mineral oil residue with a paper towel.

Sentence: How often should I water my apple tree?

Choice 1: If the tree is one or two years old, give it a really deep watering twice a week, or less often if the rain is plentiful in your area. After a fruit tree is 3 + years old water only when the soil is dry to 8 inches or so. When the tree is just establishing itself, deep watering promotes deep roots and shallow watering promotes shallow roots, a liability for a tree.

Choice 2: Apple trees don't need to be watered at all unless you live in a complete desert. Let mother nature take care of it.
